t: My Soul Longs for the Courts of the Lord
To the choirmaster: according to The Gittith. A Psalm of the Sons of Korah.
How*pn lovely is your dwelling place, O*ld Lord*s of hosts!
My*ln soul longs, yes, faints for*ld the courts of the Lord;*s my*ln heart and flesh sing for joy to*ld the living God.
Even*pn the sparrow finds a home, and*ld the swallow a nest for herself, where*ld she may lay her young, at*ln your altars, O Lord*s of hosts, my*ld King and my God.
Blessed*ln are those who dwell in your house, ever*ld singing your praise! Selah*ig
Blessed*pn are those whose strength is in you, in*ld whose heart are the highways to Zion.
As*ln they go through the Valley of Baca they*ld make it a place of springs; the*ld early rain also covers it with pools.
They*ln go from strength to strength; each*ld one appears before God in Zion.
O*pn Lord*s God of hosts, hear my prayer; give*ld ear, O God of Jacob! Selah*ig
Behold*ln our shield, O God; look*ld on the face of your anointed!
For*pn a day in your courts is better than*ld a thousand elsewhere. I*ln would rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God than*ld dwell in the tents of wickedness.
For*ln the Lord*s God is a sun and shield; the*ld Lord*s bestows favor and honor. No*ln good thing does he withhold from*ld those who walk uprightly.
O*ln Lord*s of hosts, blessed*ld is the one who trusts in you!
